DataElement.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT2 TNM Finding Digital Rectal Examination Assessment Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text statement to describe the extent of the clinical spread of prostate cancer (cT2) in which the Digital Rectal Exam (DRE) showed evidence of induration and/or nodularity but no evidence of local extension (organ confined).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT2 TNM Finding Digital Rectal Examination Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer confined within the prostate.  Tumor found in one or both lobes by needle biopsy, but not palpable or reliably visible by imaging, is classified as T1c. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)_An examination that checks for abnormalities of organs or other structures in the pelvis and lower abdomen. During a digital rectal exam, a health professional inserts a lubricated, gloved finger of one hand into the rectum and may use the other hand to press on the lower abdomen or pelvic area._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT2 TNM Finding v7
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer confined within the prostate.  Tumor found in one or both lobes by needle biopsy, but not palpable or reliably visible by imaging, is classified as T1c. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

During a digital rectal exam, a health professional inserts a lubricated, gloved finger of one hand into the rectum and may use the other hand to press on the lower abdomen or pelvic area.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT2 TNM Finding Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer confined within the prostate.  Tumor found in one or both lobes by needle biopsy, but not palpable or reliably visible by imaging, is classified as T1c._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.value: Induration and/or Nodularity  Involves > 1/2 of One Lobe (cT2b)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer cT2b TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT2b TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer with tumor involving more than one-half of one lobe, but not both lobes. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cT2b TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer with tumor involving more than one-half of one lobe, but not both lobes. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: Induration and/or Nodularity Involves ≤ 1/2 of One Lobe (cT2a)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer cT2a TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT2a TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer with tumor involving one-half of one lobe or less. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cT2a TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer with tumor involving one-half of one lobe or less. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: Abnormal DRE, Without Evidence of Extraprostatic Extension (cT2x)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Abnormal DRE, Without Evidence of Extraprostatic Extension (cT2x)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Abnormal DRE, Without Evidence of Extraprostatic Extension (cT2x)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Abnormal DRE, Without Evidence of Extraprostatic Extension (cT2x)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer cT2c TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT2c TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer with tumor involving both lobes. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cT2c TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer with tumor involving both lobes. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)
